meanings.definition: A feeling of anxiety or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: The sudden unease in the room made everyone quiet.
meanings.sent2: Her unease grew as the dark clouds gathered overhead.
meanings.sent3: The unease in his stomach was like a tiny storm brewing.
meanings.sent4: The unease in the air was palpable, like a heavy fog.
meanings.sent5: The unease in her voice hinted at hidden worries.

meanings.sent1: The unease of the situation made it hard to relax.
meanings.sent2: Navigating the maze filled him with unease.
meanings.sent3: The unease of the jigsaw puzzle was unexpectedly challenging.
meanings.sent4: The unease of the rocky path ahead seemed insurmountable.
meanings.sent5: The unease of the test left him feeling uneasy.
